content:
Diagnosis:		Metastatic rectal GIST with liver metastases

Molecular:		KIT exon 11 mutation positive

Trial:			AVANT-GARDE Phase II study - Arm B (Avapritinib)

Current Status:	Cycle 6 Day 1 review

[redacted name] attended for trial assessment today. Tolerating treatment well with continued good partial response. Latest trial-mandated CT on 15/4/24 shows further reduction in liver metastases (target lesion segment 7 now 2.1cm from 3.4cm at baseline, segment 4 lesion 1.8cm from 2.9cm). Primary rectal mass stable at 3.2cm. No new lesions identified.

Side effects remain manageable with grade 1 periorbital edema and occasional grade 1 nausea. Blood pressure well controlled on amlodipine 5mg daily started in cycle 3. Latest trial bloods, ECG, and echocardiogram all satisfactory. ECOG performance status remains 0.

Plan is to continue with cycle 6 Avapritinib 300mg daily as per protocol. Trial coordinator has arranged next assessment visit and CT scan for cycle 9. Will review with results in 6 weeks.

cancer_timeline.value: Primary rectal mass 3.2cm, stable from baseline
CT shows reduction in liver metastases - segment 7 lesion decreased to 2.1cm from 3.4cm baseline, segment 4 lesion decreased to 1.8cm from 2.9cm baseline
Enrolled in AVANT-GARDE Phase II study - Arm B (Avapritinib)
Started amlodipine 5mg daily for blood pressure control during cycle 3

patient_facts.value: Latest trial bloods, ECG, and echocardiogram all satisfactory

status_updates.value: Metastatic rectal GIST showing continued good partial response to Avapritinib on clinical trial with manageable toxicity
Continued partial response with reduction in liver metastases on CT, stable primary tumor
Grade 1 periorbital edema and occasional grade 1 nausea
Continuing Avapritinib 300mg daily as per trial protocol
Trial CT scan arranged for cycle 9
Review in 6 weeks with CT results
